p: The presence of benzyl benzoate, in Brasilimeria assu sp. nov. secretions is primarily acknowledged as a consequence of food ingestion and consequent incorporation to the hemolymph. In addition to other substances, decaying leaves and twigs of plants that synthesize the compound may be ingested by the species. This is corroborated by the distribution of two plant species that produce benzyl benzoate, Myroxylon balsamum (L.) Harms, and S. hirsuta; as well as many species of the genus Solanum [ 44], which are congruent with that of Brasilimeria assu sp. nov.
